p.s: A statement that is often discussed is written by Norman J. Lund and says Shakespeare never grows old.He continues to inspire each new generation.
Many modern play or theatres are based on ideas of Shakespeare.
In addition, facts about Shakespeare are a general knowledge.
But for some students, the access to a Shakespeare play could be very difficult, because the language is old and special, because he also uses words from other languages.
One important point is, that Shakespeare enriched and influenced the English language.
For students, it could interest, because the receive information of the origin of the English language.
Some quotes of Shakespeare, e.g. To be, or not to be are very famous and often used in the modern time.
Shakespeare plays often use topics that are timeless and universal.
They also describe experiences in life that everybody has, e.g. love, hate.
But some facts of his plays are old-fashioned and unrealistic.
But here, modern plays find other solutions, that have the same messages as the original play.
Through Shakespeare's plays, people get a better understanding of Shakespeare's time and the plays reflect the history and culturculture.
But for people they don't want to study English, information about Shakespeare aren't necessary.
To sum up, I am agree with Lund's quote, because Shakespeare is very often used in the mordern times.
His language is special, but also fascinating, so some people can become inspired by this language and want to know more about Shakespeare himself and the century, he lived in.
